Detailed Description

Lists all hardware-present preset sounds available on this mobile phone.

This is not necessarily the same list of preset sounds that a user would see, because an MMI implementation will probably have its own list of sounds that it would show to the user. That might actually be a mixture of driver presets, statically-compiled sound data, and factory-installed FFS sound files.

This allows you to show the list to the user and allow him to select one. Use CreateReference() to get an AudioReference for the selected preset sound.

If you don't want a preset sound then you should directly instantiate a Custom*Reference instance instead.

The instance will be Initialized during OnPowerUp(), called by the SubSystemManager(), because the SubSystem constructor will register itself with the SubSystemManager.

SharedPtr< PresetAudioReference > AudioPresetStore::CreateReference (  AudioPreset::AudioPresetSoundToneId  apoxi_tone_id  )  const
 

SharedPtr< PresetAudioReference > AudioPresetStore::CreateReference (  const WString &  preset_name  )  const
 

Instantiate an AudioReference so you can play this preset.

Instantiate an AudioReference so you can play this preset. In other words, this is a factory. Remember that AudioReferences are reference-counted, so you must call Unreference() on it when you have finished with it.

WString AudioPresetStore::GetPresetName (  const PresetAudioReference &  file_reference  )  const
 

Retrieve the preset name for an PresetAudioReference that you previously obtained from this AudioPresetStore. This is just a convenience - you could remember the name in your own code, along with the PresetAudioReference.
